It’s real. LMG now holds an official Guinness World Record for calculating the most digits of Pi. 300 trillion, to be exact. Linus and Luke dive into how the project started as a wild idea with leftover million-dollar PC hardware, the absurd infrastructure problems they faced, and how Jake tuned the entire setup to squeeze out this massive feat. This might be the most useless but satisfying record we've ever set.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ychYJ1xEvMU

title: We Broke a World Record!

Philips just did something shockingly cool: they've teamed up with Prusa to launch Fixables, a program offering 3D-printable replacement parts for their products. From grooming tools to future appliances, users can now download parts from Printables.com and even request specific models. It's the kind of right-to-repair initiative we wish every company would do, and yes, it absolutely affects our buying decisions.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ychYJ1xEvMU
